title: Removing Pre-Save Email Addresses in Email INput Fieldset
content:
Hello Mozilla Team,

I would like to thank all of you for you contribution to the project over the years. I really mean that. The Ad-ons NoScript and AdBlock PLus are my 2 most loved add-ons in history.

But I moved away from using Mozilla for some of the following reasons. As developers, I am hoping you can explain why I'm having such difficulty finding the following Basic Setting, to turn On or Off.

So I was hoping to get some advice on how to find (what must be a VERY Hidden Setting) on how to remove the email field set from Saving My EMAIL Credentials for log ins. I have gone through and LOOKED and LOOKED, I have read through the forums, I tried to go to the Email field and do "Shift+Delete" that doesn't work. I do not want to have to Make an Account or Sign In to make changes to my browser settings, that defeats the purpose of anonymity.

I find it really annoying that it seems to be This Difficult to Find this setting. Mozilla used to be a secure browser by default.

I use BRAVE almost exclusively these days, and the setting to TURN This Feature of EMAIL FIELDS SAVING EMAIL ADDRESSES "OFF" in BRAVE, was Very easy to find!

I am only giving your browser a Chance (again, after years not using it, because Brave is TOO secure for Some Websites, and its less known, and sometimes is incompatible, (I really don't mind that,it tells me BRAVE developers Are Doing Something RIGHT).

Your major browsers seems to have gotten waAay too full of features and unnecessary fluff, so far Fire Fox Focus is the only Browser that meets my needs, it reminds me of "Gecko").

However these kinds of hidden and or difficult to find settings (Like Microsoft does on their software) may be a deal breaker if I keep finding that I have to go in, and make changes to this setting frequently.

Gecko was your best idea Browser Ever! Convince me to stay.
creator: user59653317734974125477710076109159751331

title: earlier Firefox update change my bookmark folder icons and url icons so no longer visually useful?
content:
I had a UserChrome.css working great so that I could see More folders and urls in the drop down lists when I'd click on a folder icon in my toolbar displaying a large number of other folders and links (from Bookmarks Toolbar in Bookmarks).

At some point in the last year a Firefox updated totally changed them so that they are now Very small. The folders are just a tiny tiny hard to see Outline of a folder (no color) and the url icons are very tiny (but with color).

I'm no longer up to speed (as if I Every was) on how to fix this back.

UserChrome.css last changed on 2/10/17 so .. I'm not sure why the Appearance has changed?

Is there a simple fix? A colored folder icon for the folders and a bit larger colored icon from the fav.icon for the url would be nice? And I wouldn't mind if they had less space in between the folders and urls?

  1. personal-bookmarks .toolbarbutton-icon {

display: none !important; }

  1. personal-bookmarks .toolbarbutton-icon {

display: none !important; } margin: 0 2px !important; }

  1. bookmarks-ptf toolbarbutton:hover {

-moz-border-left-colors: none !important; -moz-border-right-colors: none !important; -moz-border-top-colors: none !important; -moz-border-bottom-colors: none !important; }

.bookmark-item { font-weight: normal !important; font-size: 11.5px !important; font-family: arial !important; 

  height: .9em !important;

}

thanks!!!

creator: pwatson770

title: Do we really need to sign themes for personal use?
content:
I understand the reason for signing add-ons as they may contain malicious code and need to be verified and all. I understand the reason for signing themes when they are uploaded to the Mozilla Add-ons Store, as they may contain licensed background images. I don't understand why I need to sign my own theme which I don't plan to share or distribute. I know I can use the Firefox Color addon, but it doesn't support GIFs and large images. I tried to download the resulting theme and customize it the way I like, but after that I couldn't use it. The code contained in the theme does not look like it can be modified in any way for malicious purposes, so even if someone downloads my theme, it is unlikely to harm anyone.

So why can't we just use our own themes?

Edit: Oh, and using a Developer Edition and disabling signinature check for all add-ons just to use a custom theme doesn't sound reasonable, so please don't suggest it.

title: Why do I have to use a custom setting to get back normal printing?
content:
I don't print from Firefox. That is to say, I almost never - and by "almost" I just mean "I could imagine a scenario though I can't remember one" - send data from Firefox to a piece of paper. But I save upload receipts to PDF from Firefox all the time. I'd been doing it for over a decade no problem. The Mac makes it easy - I don't know what it's like on Windows or Linux, I don't mess with those because I use a computer for business and don't have time to waste on things being cumbersome, so I just bought a good computer in the first place twenty years ago and have stuck with that platform since. When I need to save a receipt, I just click Print (command-P on the keyboard) and then click the PDF button and save it to my computer.

But, lately, every time Firefox runs an update - and it seems to do that about once a month - this breaks again, and when I click "print" I don't get my useful print dialogue with a save to PDF option, I get some other weird mess asking me about... paper handling? Like, actual printer stuff? Why?

I got it figured out, but it's extra annoying because I have to google this solution fresh every couple months because the developers change things so that my setting to restore proper behavior gets broken.

And whatever, it takes five minutes a month to keep fixing this, but just why? Why do you keep breaking my PDF print function? Is there supposed to be a benefit to this? Is there something I'm not aware of that is somehow inferior about the system print dialogue? Admittedly I may be out of the loop because I don't ever actually move web content to paper, so maybe this makes it easier to print double sided or landscape or something? I just don't understand why you have to keep changing back-door settings to make things harder for people who don't waste paper and just use the print function to save to PDF like civilized adults.
creator: jayratch

title: Addons check for updates taking longer than usual
content:
Firefox 106.3

This started happening recently I believe, with Fx 106.

Usually takes just a a matter of seconds, but now almost a minute.

Anyone else seeing this?
creator: noel_envoide
